TI: [Efferent sympathetic activity after stimulation of the amygdaloid nuclei of the rat brain].
AB: Efferent sympathetic activity (ESA) recorded from cervical sympathetic trunk, was augmented after stimulation of medial, cortical and basal amygdaloid nuclei, whereas stimulation of the lateral amygdaloid nuclei decreased the ESA. Stimulation of the dorsal hippocampus also decreased the ESA. Electrolytic lesion of the septum led to an increase of the ESA during simultaneous stimulation of the lateral amygdaloid nucleus and the dorsal hippocampus. The data suggest that functional interaction between amygdaloid nuclei and septal relays participate in the amygdaloid influence on the activity of preganglionic sympathetic neurons.
TT: Efferentnaia simpaticheskaia aktivnost' pri razdrazhenii iader mindalevidnogo kompleksa mozga krysy.
TA: Fiziol Zh SSSR Im I M Sechenova
JT: Fiziologicheskii zhurnal SSSR imeni I. M. Sechenova
SO: Fiziol Zh SSSR Im I M Sechenova. 1984 Apr;70(4):405-10.
